title: "An unspecified error has occured"
body: Recently my League of Legends file corrupted and I had to reinstall, several times during the reinstalled process when patching I have been given the message "An unspecified error has occurred" I have restarted my pc several times and stopped and started the client. Very frustrating as I want to play the new patch has been doing this for 3 days so far. Any help appreciated!

replies.body: This error can be for different reasons depending on when it happened?  To be able to help here, can you tell me what % specifically you got this error?  Let me know!

it usually happens between 1-33% the game actually finished last night but when I clicked launch nothing happened and when I bypassed that by opening file location I go the maestro error. So now I'm reinstalling and having the same issue.

Thanks for the info!  During this time, your patcher is trying to scan your game files and prepare them for an update.  Something with your pc settings could be blocking that from happening, which would result in the unspecified error.  I suggest running over the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure that access is being allowed.  I hope that helps!

Thanks for the help! Pretty much I updated windows and tried clicking launch again which didn't work but then I went to. Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/projects/league client/releases/0.0.0.57/deploy/ then found the league launcher and when opened it updates the client icon on the desktop and gives me the new client when opened I'm pretty sure that was the issue but I'm no expert the patcher said it was updating my client but didn't. Hope this helps, thanks for the time!
